author: Antonio Rubio Ato
title: AEW Dynamite: Audiencia 27 de diciembre de 2023 | Solowrestling
text: 28/12/2023 a las 23:05 El √∫ltimo episodio de [AEW Dynamite](https://solowrestling.mundodeportivo.com/new/126107-resultados-aew-dynamite-holiday-bash-20-de-diciembre-de-2023), "New Year's Smash", emitido el 27 de diciembre en TBS, registr√≥ una audiencia de 843.000 espectadores, seg√∫n informa Brandon Thurston de WrestleNomics. Este dato representa un aumento respecto a la cifra de la semana anterior, que alcanz√≥ 782.000 espectadores de media. AEW Dynamite registr√≥ un 0.31 de share en la demograf√≠a de inter√©s, correspondiente a las edades entre 18 y 49 a√±os, mejorando el dato de la semana pasada (0.26). El episodio de esta semana cont√≥ con varios puntos de inter√©s, destacando las victorias de Jon Moxley y Eddie Kingston en las finales de las Gold y Blue League del AEW Continental Classic y la victoria de los esbirros de The Devil sobre MJF y Samoa Joe para ganar los Campeonatos Mundiales por Parejas de ROH en el evento estelar de la noche. |Fecha||Audiencia| |4 enero||864.000 espectadores| |11 enero||967.000| |18 enero||969.000| |25 enero||1.003.000| |1 febrero||901.000| |8 febrero||899.000| |15 febrero||824.000| |22 febrero||1.028.000| |1 marzo||833.000| |8 marzo||858.000| |15 marzo||852.000| |22 marzo||954.000| |29 marzo||833.000| |5 abril||877.000| |12 abril||866.000| |19 abril||830.000| |26 abril||863.000| |3 mayo||776.000| |10 mayo||877.000| |17 mayo||814.000| |24 mayo||846.000| |31 mayo||923.000| |7 junio||903.000| |14 junio||832.000| |21 junio||902.000| |28 junio||809.000| |5 julio||855.000| |12 julio||825.000| |19 julio||953.000| |26 julio||898.000| |2 agosto||894.000| |9 agosto||846.000| |16 agosto||874.000| |23 agosto||870.000| |30 agosto||871.000| |6 septiembre||887.000| |13 septiembre||888.000| |20 septiembre||984.000| |27 septiembre||855.000| |4 octubre||800.000| |10 octubre||609.000| |18 octubre||901.000| |25 octubre||774.000| |1 noviembre||832.000| |8 noviembre||804.000| |15 noviembre||823.000| |22 noviembre||845.000| |29 noviembre||858.000| |6 diciembre||823.000| |13 diciembre||845.000| |20 diciembre||782.000| |27 diciembre||843.000| No te olvides de visitar Solowrestling, la web con todas las [noticias de AEW](https://solowrestling.mundodeportivo.com/). S√≠guenos en redes sociales, [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC53gtIkOFfcrarBmIZBvcCA/), Temas relacionados: [All Elite Wrestling](https://solowrestling.mundodeportivo.com/tag/all-elite-wrestling) [AEW Dynamite](https://solowrestling.mundodeportivo.com/tag/aew-dynamite)

author: Isadora Carvalho
title: Trabalhadores relatam maus-tratos e agress√µes em f√°brica da BYD na Bahia
text:
H√° pouco mais de um m√™s estivemos na f√°brica da BYD em Cama√ßari , na Bahia, e constatamos que a opera√ß√£o na √°rea da empresa acontece 24 horas ininterruptamente. Ser√£o 26 novas instala√ß√µes entre galp√µes de produ√ß√£o, pista de testes e outras estruturas que v√£o ocupar uma √°rea de cerca de 1 milh√£o de m¬≤ adjacente √† f√°brica que era da Ford . O prazo para o fim das obras √© dezembro de 2025.
Por√©m todo esse desenvolvimento parece cobrar o seu pre√ßo . Segundo reportagem da Ag√™ncia P√∫blica cerca de 500 funcion√°rios chineses estariam em condi√ß√µes degradantes na constru√ß√£o da primeira f√°brica de carros el√©tricos do Brasil.
Relacionadas Carros el√©tricos BYD e Shell instalar√£o 600 carregadores r√°pidos no Brasil at√© 2027 Segredo BYD lan√ßar√° cinco modelos in√©ditos no Brasil at√© o fim de 2025; veja quais ser√£o Testes BYD Yuan Pro √© um bom SUV el√©trico ofuscado pela pr√≥pria marca Entre as den√∫ncias recebidas pela ag√™ncia est√£o agress√µes f√≠sicas, com chutes e pontap√©s. Alojamentos sujos, aglomerados, mal iluminados e sem divis√£o entre homens e mulheres. Banheiros imundos, sem limpeza di√°ria das pias e dos vasos sanit√°rios. Oper√°rios atuando sem equipamentos de prote√ß√£o individual, submetidos a rotinas de 12 horas por dia, de domingo a domingo.
Funcion√°rios s√£o transportados no porta-malas (Ag√™ncia P√∫blica/Reprodu√ß√£o) Todas essas situa√ß√µes estariam acontecendo dentro do canteiro de obras da BYD, que por sua vez, contratou cerca de 470 oper√°rios chineses de tr√™s empresas.
O Jinjiang Group faz o servi√ßo de terraplanagem, que √© a prepara√ß√£o da √°rea para o in√≠cio das obras e, em m√©dia, utiliza 280 funcion√°rios. A Open Steel √© respons√°vel pela montagem da estrutura met√°lica da f√°brica e mant√©m 100 funcion√°rios chineses trabalhando nessa fun√ß√£o. J√° a AE Corp tem como responsabilidade montar a estrutura met√°lica interna, onde ser√£o produzidos os carros el√©tricos, com uma for√ßa de trabalho de 90 funcion√°rios.
A alimenta√ß√£o √© prec√°ria e servida em baldes (Ag√™ncia P√∫blica/Reprodu√ß√£o) Continua ap√≥s a publicidade As situa√ß√µes mais degradantes teriam acontecido com funcion√°rios da chinesa Jinjiang Group. H√° fotos e v√≠deos que mostram uma s√©rie de maus-tratos. √â poss√≠vel ver oper√°rios bebendo √°gua salobra das po√ßas formadas no canteiro, j√° que n√£o teriam acesso a √°gua pot√°vel. Alguns trabalham descal√ßos ou sem os capacetes obrigat√≥rios para prote√ß√£o individual durante as obras.
Funcion√°rios entrevistados pela P√∫blica sob condi√ß√£o de sigilo confirmaram essas den√∫ncias. De acordo com eles, os mestres de obras, tamb√©m chineses, por mais de uma vez, teriam golpeado os oper√°rios com pontap√©s e socos.
Um dos casos aconteceu em 9 de outubro, de acordo com as den√∫ncias. Um v√≠deo registra o momento em que um chin√™s aparece ca√≠do no ch√£o depois de, segundo relatos, ter levado um chute pelas costas. Seria costumeiro ocorrerem cenas de viol√™ncia quando h√° descumprimento de ordem ou demora na execu√ß√£o das tarefas.
Continua ap√≥s a publicidade De acordo com uma fonte ouvida pela P√∫blica, houve um atraso e o novo prazo estimado √© de finaliza√ß√£o da primeira etapa em janeiro de 2025 e pode explicar o aumento no n√≠vel de tens√£o no canteiro de obras, mas n√£o justifica a viol√™ncia f√≠sica.
Compartilhe essa mat√©ria via: WhatsAPP Telegram Na empresa AE Corp h√° outras den√∫ncias de viola√ß√µes, o refeit√≥rio para alimenta√ß√£o foi montado no mesmo local de trabalho ‚Äì o que configuraria jornada continuada, pois n√£o h√° tempo para descanso.
Falta de comunica√ß√£o Os brasileiros que tamb√©m atuam na obra relataram que os chineses t√™m enorme dificuldade de comunica√ß√£o para formalizar algum tipo de den√∫ncia, pois eles n√£o entendem o portugu√™s, assim como os brasileiros tamb√©m n√£o conseguem se expressar em mandarim, canton√™s ou nenhum dos outros cinco idiomas falados na China.
Continua ap√≥s a publicidade De acordo com a reportagem funcion√°rios brasileiros cumprem uma carga hor√°ria das 8h √†s 18h (na BYD), com uma hora de descanso para refei√ß√£o. Nas demais terceirizadas ‚Äì no Jinjiang Group, Open Steel e AE Corp ‚Äì, a carga hor√°ria seria das 7h √†s 17h, com duas horas de almo√ßo.
Comida √© muitas vezes servida dentro de coolers (Ag√™ncia P√∫blica/Reprodu√ß√£o) De acordo com um funcion√°rio brasileiro mesmo os chineses que trabalham em fun√ß√µes administrativas, s√£o submetidos a jornadas mais intensas que os brasileiros. Como precisam responder a processos para a matriz chinesa, muitas vezes trabalham de madrugada para se adaptar ao fuso hor√°rio de 11 horas.
A Constitui√ß√£o brasileira assegura aos trabalhadores estrangeiros os mesmos direitos dos brasileiros, como 13¬∫ sal√°rio, adicional de f√©rias, 30 dias de f√©rias remuneradas, Fundo de Garantia do Tempo de Servi√ßo (FGTS) e cumprimento de jornada de trabalho constitucionalmente prevista, portanto 8 horas por dia ou 44 horas semanais.
As obras no terreno de Cama√ßari come√ßaram em mar√ßo de 2024. De acordo com os relatos de funcion√°rios ouvidos pela P√∫blica, em abril, ou seja, um m√™s desde o come√ßo da montagem, j√° havia relatos de viola√ß√µes a direitos trabalhistas de funcion√°rios chineses.
Continua ap√≥s a publicidade J√° houve fiscaliza√ß√£o De acordo com a ag√™ncia P√∫blica no dia 11 de novembro a Pol√≠cia Federal e o MPT (Minist√©rio P√∫blico do Trabalho) estiveram no canteiro de obras para uma vistoria das condi√ß√µes de trabalho, mas n√£o chegaram a ir aos alojamentos ou percorrer todo o espa√ßo de montagem da f√°brica, segundo fontes ouvidas pela reportagem.
Banheiros sem limpeza di√°ria e impr√≥prios para o uso (Ag√™ncia P√∫blica/Reprodu√ß√£o) O MPT confirmou que h√° um inqu√©rito em andamento e as den√∫ncias s√£o importantes para o avan√ßo das investiga√ß√µes.
QUATRO RODAS procurou a BYD para comentar as den√∫ncias recebidas e a empresa nos enviou o seguinte posicionamento oficial:
A BYD recebeu com indigna√ß√£o as imagens relacionadas ao tratamento dado por profissionais das construtoras terceirizadas aos trabalhadores na constru√ß√£o da f√°brica de Cama√ßari (BA). De imediato, a empresa determinou que os agressores sejam proibidos de atuar na unidade e exigiu das empreiteiras provid√™ncias urgentes para garantir que tais incidentes n√£o se repitam.
Continua ap√≥s a publicidade Al√©m disso, a BYD est√° implantando um refor√ßo em sua fiscaliza√ß√£o da obra para assegurar o cumprimento da legisla√ß√£o e o respeito a todos os profissionais que nela atuam. A companhia opera h√° 10 anos no Brasil, sempre seguindo rigorosamente as leis locais e mantendo o compromisso com a √©tica e o respeito.
Com um investimento de R$5,5 bilh√µes, a f√°brica de Cama√ßari representa um marco estrat√©gico e tem potencial para gerar mais de 20 mil empregos diretos e indiretos.
Publicidade
Quatro Rodas no YouTube Mitsubishi Triton 2025 abandona nome L200 e est√° MAIS POTENTE QUE HILUX com 2.4 biturbo

author: Amy Larson
title: California digital health company execs arrested in alleged ADHD drug scheme | KTLA
text: Two California digital health company executives were arrested on Thursday for allegedly making $100 million in revenue by funneling Adderall and Ritalin to illegitimate patients, KTLA sister station KRON is reporting. David Brody, the clinical president of Done, was arrested in San Rafael. Brody will make his first court appearance in a San Francisco courtroom on Thursday afternoon. Ruthia He, the founder and CEO of Done Inc., was arrested in Los Angeles. Federal investigators said the duo conspired to provide easy access to stimulants over the internet in exchange for monthly subscription fees from patients. A grand jury indictment alleges that the conspiracy‚Äôs purpose was for Done executives to unlawfully enrich themselves by prescribing over 40 million pills to patients, many of whom were never medically evaluated. Adderall and Ritalin are prescription stimulant drugs used to treat attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). Done was founded in 2020 as a digital telemedicine health company based in Northern California. It operated on a subscription-based model and advertised that it provided online diagnosis, treatment, and medication refills for ADHD. In 2022 the FDA issued a nationwide notice of shortages in prescription stimulants, including Adderall and Ritalin. Legitimate patients with ADHD struggled to refill their prescriptions as pharmacies were unable to maintain supplies. DEA Administrator Anne Milgram said, ‚ÄúInstead of properly addressing medical needs, the defendants allegedly made millions of dollars by pushing addictive medications. Any diversion of Adderall and other prescription stimulant pills to persons who have no medical need only exacerbates this shortage and hurts any American with a legitimate medical need for these drugs.‚Äù Amphetamine-dextroamphetamine is sold generically and under a variety of brand names, including Adderall. Methylphenidate is sometimes sold under the brand name Ritalin. Pharmacists are required to exercise sound professional judgment, and to adhere to professional standards, when making a determination about the legitimacy of a controlled substance prescription. Brody was a psychiatrist who maintained a DEA registration number and was authorized to prescribe controlled substances in California. Ruthia He owned, controlled, and operated Done. Done‚Äôs prescribers wrote prescriptions for Done members ‚Äúwithout an examination, sometimes based solely on a short video or audio communication and limited patient intake documents, or without any video or audio communication at all,‚Äù an indictment states. According to the indictment, the scheme racked up thousands of members by spending millions of dollars on deceptive social media advertisements, as well as by intentionally targeting drug-seeking patients. The indictment was filed on Wednesday in U.S. District Court Northern District of California. Guy Ficco of IRS Criminal Investigation said some Done members overdosed and died. ‚ÄúInstead of prioritizing the health of their customers, He and Brody‚Äôs telemedicine company allegedly prioritized profits ‚Äî more than $100 million worth ‚Äî by fraudulently prescribing medications,‚Äù Ficco said. ‚ÄúThis led customers to addiction, abuse, and overdoses, which the company tried to conceal by making false representations to the media in order to deter oversight by government agencies.‚Äù As more health care needs are met through telemedicine, fraud schemes that recklessly exploit digital technologies will prosecuted, federal officials said. He and Brody are charged with conspiracy to distribute controlled substances, distribution of controlled substances, conspiracy to commit health care fraud, and conspiracy to obstruct justice. If convicted, He and Brody each face a maximum penalty of 20 years in prison.

author: Rob McKnight
title: Radio ratings: Kyle Sandilands threatens to pull his show out of Melbourne after another bad result
text:
Welcome to our special coverage of the results of survey 2 radio ratings for 2025, where all eyes will be on the Melbourne breakfast radio wars.
The survey dates released today cover February 9 to April 12.
MELBOURNE
Know the news with the 7NEWS app: Download today
THE STORY: In survey 1 Jase & Lauren on Nova fell to second place (if you‚Äôre only counting the FM frequency ‚Äì which has never made sense to me), to be beaten by The Christian O‚ÄôConnell Show on Gold 104.3.
Jase and Lauren are considered the underdogs who‚Äôve come good after being flicked by KIIS to make way for The Kyle and Jackie O show, which has failed to have any major impact on the Melbourne market.
For their part, K&J have toned down the show after making headlines for overtly sexual content which doesn‚Äôt seem to have gone down well down south.
Previous results have even forced the show to do a live show and competition from the city, despite previous claims they wouldn‚Äôt be partaking in any localism to try and get listeners.
And on the eve of the ratings results things took a dramatic turn with Kyle threatening to take the show off air in Melbourne by the end of the year if ratings don‚Äôt improve.
As The Age reports, Sandilands warned he and Jackie O were not going to ‚Äúsuper serve Melbourne and ignore our Sydney audience‚Äù.
‚ÄúYou either glue on in Melbourne or you [expletive]. One or the other. Here‚Äôs something I haven‚Äôt even discussed with Jackie... if we don‚Äôt rate better by the end of this year, I‚Äôm pulling the carpet out. I‚Äôll just take the show off Melbourne,‚Äù Sandilands said.
THE RESULTS:
3AW continues to dominate the Melbourne market with the station bringing in a 14.1% share followed by GOLD on 12.5%. Then there‚Äôs a big gap with NOVA coming in third on 8.9%.
In the all-important breakfast battle, Kyle and Jackie O have had a slight increase of 0.7%. That result doesn‚Äôt even get them into the top 5 and their lowly 5.8% share won‚Äôt do anything to please Kyle, but will he follow through with his threat to pull the show out of Melbourne at the end of the year?
Only time will tell ‚Äì but that decision will have a major impact for ARN which has made a LOT of people redundant to pay for the Kyle and Jackie O expansion experiment.
Meanwhile, Ross and Russ have done it again with a massive 18.8% share, easily making them Melbourne‚Äôs #1.
On the FM dial, GOLD‚Äôs Christian O‚ÄôConnell takes bragging rights at #1 with a 10.8% share, ahead of Jase & Lauren on 10.2% on NOVA.
The new ABC breakfast team of Sharnelle Vella and Bob Murphy has shed -0.7% of its survey 1 audience, now sitting at 5.6%.
SYDNEY
THE STORY: 2GB has started the year in a very strong position despite major changes at Nine‚Äôs radio station. Mark Levey retained the #1 position in Mornings after taking over from Ray Hadley and newly installed Clinton Maynard managed to increase his audience in the Drive slot.
This will be the one to watch in Survey 2 to see if audiences like the new hosts across the station.
THE RESULTS: Overall, 2GB remains Sydney‚Äôs top station, with SMOOTH coming in second on 11.8%.
Ben Fordham is having a dream run in breakfast securing the #1 spot on 15.6% ‚Äî that‚Äôs an increase of 1.2%.
Mark Levey has increased his audience from survey 1 after taking over from Ray Hadley. With an increase of 1.2% Levey managed to secure a 15.6% share.
Ray who?
Clinton Maynard has also increased his audience in drive to bring in a 8.2% share.
Back to breakfast and it‚Äôs a much better story for Kyle and Jackie O in their hometown with the show coming in second overall and #1 on the FM dial. While the show dropped -1% K&J still managed to bring in an impressive 12.3% share of the audience.
BRISBANE
THE STORY: Just like in Sydney, the AM dial is the main focus of attention in Brisbane, but for very different reasons.
Nine has faced many hurdles with a string of line-up and format changes which has seen ratings slip to record lows. The two slots to keep an eye on are breakfast and drive.
Meanwhile, B105‚Äôs Stav, Abby and Matt have been a strong #1 while Robyn and Kip and KIIS are trying to hang onto their jobs before the expected invasion from Kyle and Jackie O, who plan for a national breakfast show.
THE RESULTS: There will be a sigh of relief at AM talkback station 4BC (where I once worked) with audience rising across the board.
In something of a shock at breakfast, B105‚Äôs Stav, Abbey, they‚Äôve been ousted from the #1 spot by Ash, Luttsy & Nikki Osborne on NOVA who had a 13.6% share of the audience. The team at B105 were forced to share second spot with Triple M Breakfast With Marto & Margaux. Both shows had 13.2% share, but B105 saw a drop of -0.9%.
Triple M took top honours overall with 12.9% of the audience, followed by NOVA on 11.7.
ADELAIDE
THE STORY: Listeners in the city of churches love Roo, Ditts, and Loz on Triple M who took out survey 1 with a 14% share. That result in breakfast helped the station increase its audience and take out the top slot.
MIX will be hoping to reclaim its spot at the top but the competition is expected to be fierce.
THE RESULTS: While MIX have claimed the #1 position overall with a 14% share, ahead of NOVA (12.5%) and Triple M (12.2%), the news isn‚Äôt so good in breakfast.
Despite a drop of -0.8% Roo, Ditts, and Loz have done it again with a 13.2% share, ahead of NOVA (12.8%) and MIX (12%).
PERTH
THE STORY: The people in Perth have fallen in love with Nova, with the station increasing its share in the previous survey, keeping 96Fm in second spot.
6PR dropped overall by a small margin despite major programming structure changes, but its nights program, networked from Melbourne, actually increased audience by 2.6% in the previous survey.
THE RESULTS: NOVA is #1 out west with a 17% share, followed by 96FM on 15.2% and MIX (11.8%). 6PR saw a slight increase of 0.2% for a 7.3% share.
Nathan, Nat & Shaun continue to be a dominant force in breakfast with a 21.7% share ‚Äì an increase of 1.9%. 96FM‚Äôs Clairsy & Lisa were way behind in second place with a 13.3% share.
6PR continues to defy traditional thinking in the Nights slot, with its show from Melobourne increasing audience share by 1.1%.
Rob McKnight is a content specialist for 7NEWS, previously worked for Nine radio (and still appears as a regular guest on 2GB) and is the co-owner of TV Blackbox.
INSIDE MEDIA is published every Monday and Thursday on the 7NEWS website.
Stream free on

title: Cristiano Ronaldo batte un altro colpo: gol numero 900 in carriera - TUTTO mercato WEB

author: Brendan McFadden
title: New Year's Eve: Fireworks light up the sky as the UK sees in 2024
text:
Britons flocked to New Year‚Äôs Eve celebration at cities across the country depite gale-force winds and heavy showers.
Depite weather warnings being issued by the Met Office, crowds were out in force to watch spectacular pyrotechnics light up the sky.
In London, the country‚Äôs biggest display took place over the River Thames, which was attended by 100,000 people, as millions watched the BBC‚Äôs coverage at home.
At the stroke of midnight Big Ben‚Äôs bongs rang out as fireworks and drones mesmerised the crowds.
The spectacular display over the London Eye and Big Ben in London (Photo: by HENRY NICHOLLS / AFP) At midnight the words ‚ÄúLondon: A Place for Everyone‚Äù illuminated the sky, before fireworks were fires 400m into the air.
During the display, which marked the King‚Äôs coronation year, the voice of monarch praised the Windrush Generation (people who emigrated to Britian between 1945 and 1960).
He said the new arrivals ‚Äúcollectively enrich the fabric of our national life‚Äù.
During the display, music from the Spice Girls, the Kinks and Beyonce was also heard.
There were repeated references to London‚Äôs diversity and inclusivity, with the capital telling the world everyone is welcome in a city where people can be themselves.
According to the office of the Mayor of London Sadiq Khan, the display involved 2,000 fireworks, 600 drones, 430 lights and a varied soundtrack of songs and voice-over clips.
Mr Khan described the display the ‚Äúbest and biggest ever celebration‚Äù in London and said it ‚Äúsent a message of unity and showing why London is the greatest city in the world‚Äù.
Manchester hosted its New Year‚Äôs Eve firework display for the first time since the Covid pandemic forced the annual celebrations to be postponed.
Fireworks explode over Edinburgh Castle during the street party for Hogmanay New Year celebrations. (Photo: PA) Revellers at the Hogmanay New Year celebrations in Edinburgh. (Photo: Jane Barlow/PA Wire) Crowds packed into Castlefield Bowl music venue to watch a live DJ set from Hits Radio DJ Jordan Lee, which was followed by a huge firework display to bring in the New Year.
BREAKING: The UK welcomes in 2024 with a fireworks and light show spectacular over the River Thames in London
More ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/Ry2HAB3vSJ
üì∫ Sky 501, Virgin 602, Freeview 233 and YouTube pic.twitter.com/ibcmDyUyHt
‚Äî Sky News (@SkyNews) January 1, 2024 In the Scottish capital Ediburgh, tens of thousands were mesmerised by the Hogmany firework displays on Princess Street near Edinburgh Castle.
After the fireworks were over Princess Street was packed with people singing Auld Lang Syne and dancing.
Thousands of people also partied into 2014 at the Princes Garden Street Party and Concert in the Gardens, which was headlined by Pulp, who have not played in the city in 20 years.
Ahead of the celebrations, two yellow weather alerts were issued by the Met Office for parts of England and Wales, which warned severe gales would bring heavy showers.
Elsewhere an impressive firework show took place Blackpool, which illuminated its iconic Blackpool Tower illuminated
In Newcastle‚Äôs Quayside crowds BAFTA award-winning artist Seb Lee-Delisle‚Äôs new Laser Light City laser show was emblazoned onto the Baltic Flour Mills.
Caption: Fireworks explode over Edinburgh Castle during the street party for Hogmanay New Year celebrations in Edinburgh (Photo: PA) The Hogmanay New Year celebrations in Edinburgh (Photo: PA) Some events were cancelled because of the blustery conditions, including Plymouth‚Äôs Winter Wonderland in Central Park, which cancelled its events which were meant to run from 6pm until midnight, due to high winds.
In a Facebook post, it said: ‚ÄúUnfortunately we have taken the very difficult decision to cancel our New Year‚Äôs Eve event due to the high winds expected.‚Äù
Barnstaple in Devon cancelled its fireworks display due to ‚Äúgusting winds‚Äù.
The first country to celebrate 2024 was Pacific island nation of Kiribati which celebrated at 10am GMT.
It was followed soon after by New Zealand‚Äôs capital, Auckland, who put on an impressive fireworks display, at its tallest building, the Sky Tower was emblazoned with ifferent colours.
Sydney‚Äôs famous pryotechnics lit up the sky over the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House.
Landmarks in countries across Europe were also lit up by displays, including the Acropolis in Athens, Greece and Berlin‚Äôs Brandenburg Gate.
